description: This Passover holiday recipe, an ancient jewel of Jewish Provençal cooking, feels modern with our new love of Swiss chard It is traditional to use a whole veal breast with all the bones, but that makes for a giant roast by today’s standards For this simplified but magnificent version, have a butcher trim, butterfly and remove the bones -- and save them to cook beside the meat, where they will add flavor and texture to the braise
title: Provençal Veal Breast Stuffed With Swiss Chard
title_page: Provençal Veal Breast Stuffed With Swiss Chard Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
This Passover holiday recipe, an ancient jewel of Jewish Provençal cooking, feels modern with our new love of Swiss chard. It is traditional to use a whole veal breast with all the bones, but that makes for a giant roast by today’s standards. For this simplified but magnificent version, have a butcher trim, butterfly and remove the bones -- and save them to cook beside the meat, where they will add flavor and texture to the braise. The dish tastes best cooked a day ahead to allow the flavors to blend.
Featured in: A Seder Feast In Provence, With Roots In Ancient Rome.
